p: Where; P (kN) is the induced thermal axial compressive load when the superstructure of the bridge is restrained form expansion and M (kN.m) is the bending moment due to dead load (weight of the materials), live load (traffic) and the thermal load (due to the eccentricity of the thermal axial load); γ is the load factor for the limit state Service II [ 39]; P n (kN) is the nominal axial compression strength and M n (kN.m) is the moment strength of the composite superstructure of the bridge; ϕ c and ϕ f are the resistance factor for axial compression and flexure (ϕ c = ϕ f = 1 for service limit state [ 39]).
